meanings.definition: To boast more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outboasted her friend by talking about her achievements all day.
meanings.sent2: He outboasted his classmates by claiming he could run the fastest.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully outboasted each other about who could eat the most ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her loud laughter outboasted the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The colorful peacock outboasted the other birds with its magnificent feathers.

meanings.definition: To have boasted more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They had outboasted their opponents before the game even started.
meanings.sent2: The team outboasted their rivals with their impressive winning streak.
meanings.sent3: The siblings outboasted each other about who had the messier room.
meanings.sent4: His grand tales outboasted all the other storytellers in the village.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece outboasted all the other paintings in the gallery.
